channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Brain Gear Is the Hot New Wearable
item.description: Smartwatches are cool and all, but have you considered wearable neurotech?

item.title: How Elon Musk Won His No Good, Very Bad Year
item.description: The billionaire’s involvement with the Trump administration and DOGE had deep impacts on Tesla’s bottom line. But Elon Musk was still able to turn his...

item.title: The Future of EVs Is Foggy—but California Still Wants More of Them
item.description: Hamstrung by lawsuits, the state can’t officially keep its goal to ban new gas-powered car sales by 2035. But it’s going to keep trying.

item.title: Waymo resumes service in San Francisco after robotaxis stall during blackout
item.description: Waymo suspended its SF robotaxi service on Saturday evening after a massive blackout appeared to leave many of its vehicles stalled on city streets.

item.title: Tech Disrupted Friendship. It’s Time to Bring It Back
item.description: Two decades ago social media promised to connect people with pals far and wide. Twenty years online has left us turning to AI for kinship. IRL compani...

item.title: Politics Is Fandom; Fascism Is Fanfic
item.description: From Zohran Mamdani’s campaign to the US government’s Halo memes, fandom has become the defining language of US politics.

item.title: Israel’s famed VC Jon Medved, diagnosed with ALS, backed the tech that will improve his life
item.description: In perhaps the last public interview of one Israel's most famous VCs, Jon Medved tells TechCrunch how tech will enhance his life.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Bankruptcy takes out two
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility, your hub for all things “future of transportation.”

item.title: As EU waters down 2035 EV goals, electric startups express concern
item.description: The future may be electric, but that future is being postponed. The European Commission, citing the need for flexibility, has softened its ambitious p...

item.title: A rough week for hardware companies
item.description: iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes were very different companies, but they faced some similar challenges.
